dt.t: Some of them {wi}regained{/wi} the weight they had lost.
… was still alive and slowly {wi}regaining{/wi} consciousness.
… managed to {wi}regain{/wi} control of the airplane and execute a successful landing …
After a prolonged struggle to {wi}regain{/wi} the ridge, during which the only assistance my partners could offer was a tight rope, I crawled back along the path I had so recently chiseled …
… one of them was unhorsed and then, when out of view, {wi}regained{/wi} his saddle.

shortdef: to gain (something) anew : to get (something) again : recover
to get back to (something) : to reach (something) again
